meanings.definition: A person whose occupation is making or altering garments.
meanings.sent1: The tailors in the shop were busy sewing new clothes.
meanings.sent2: My mom took my dress to the tailors to get it fixed.
meanings.sent3: The tailors had a sewing competition to see who was the fastest.
meanings.sent4: She tailored the dress to fit perfectly, like a glove.
meanings.sent5: The tailors worked diligently to finish the order on time.

meanings.definition: To make or adapt (something) for a particular purpose or person.
meanings.sent1: He tailors his speeches to suit his audience.
meanings.sent2: She tailors each lesson to meet the needs of her students.
meanings.sent3: The chef tailors the recipe to include everyone's favorite ingredients.
meanings.sent4: She tailors her approach to each individual, like a skilled craftsman.
meanings.sent5: The company tailors its products to cater to different customer preferences.
